channel.title: Training on Tan Ho
channel.description: Recent content in Training on Tan Ho

item.title: Lifting for Rec Rowers
item.description: Lifting weights is the best way to build strength, which translates to peak power in rowing. This is a guide intended for the adult rec/masters rower looking to improve that strength (both over the offseason and as supplemental training during the rowing season.) Philosophy Thoughts “Better athletes are better rowers.” In targeting the average rec/masters rower, I’m making a few basic assumptions: Time is limited. We are working adults balancing busy schedules, not varsity athletes with the time to dedicate two-a-days six days per week specifically to rowing.

item.title: Short Mobility Warmup - Rec Rowing
item.description: The few short minutes before ORC Rec practices are often hectic as everyone rushes over after work, gets coach boats and equipment ready, and then hops into a boat. That said, I’m hoping to add another wrench into the works this year - a short dynamic warmup to promote mobility and get ourselves ready for rowing. Short Description Two sets of the following circuit: Halos (5 reps in each direction)
